prompt: A healthcare data platform with FHIR API, HIPAA-compliant storage, real-time patient monitoring, Azure Health Data Services, and Power BI for clinical dashboards

services.name: Azure API for FHIR
services.description: FHIR-compliant API endpoint for clinical applications and Azure Health Data Services

services.name: Azure IoT Hub
services.description: Ingests real-time patient device telemetry and monitoring data

services.name: Azure Stream Analytics
services.description: Processes real-time patient telemetry streams and generates clinical alerts

services.name: Azure Data Factory
services.description: Orchestrates batch ingestion of FHIR resources into HIPAA-compliant storage

services.name: Azure Data Lake Storage
services.description: Central HIPAA-compliant data lake for normalized FHIR data and time-series telemetry

services.name: Power BI Embedded
services.description: Hosts clinical dashboards and reports for clinicians and care teams

services.name: Microsoft Entra ID
services.description: Provides authentication and role-based access control for clinical users and services

services.name: Key Vault
services.description: Stores secrets, keys, and certificates for secure data access and encryption

services.name: Azure Monitor
services.description: Collects metrics and logs from the real-time processing layer

services.name: Log Analytics
services.description: Central workspace for querying and correlating platform telemetry

connections.label: Authenticate clinical applications accessing FHIR APIs using OAuth2/OpenID Connect
Authenticate clinicians and enforce RBAC for embedded clinical dashboards
Export FHIR resources via batch pipelines for downstream analytics
Persist FHIR snapshots and audit logs into HIPAA-compliant data lake
Stream real-time patient telemetry messages for clinical rule evaluation
Write curated and aggregated telemetry streams into analytical storage
Load transformed FHIR clinical data into structured zones in the data lake
Query curated clinical datasets to render interactive dashboards
Provide secure connection strings and keys for batch data movement
Provide output sink credentials for streaming analytics jobs
Emit job metrics and diagnostic logs for real-time processing
Forward collected telemetry into centralized log analytics workspace

workflow.description: Clinical applications and users authenticate via Microsoft Entra ID before calling the FHIR API or viewing dashboards.
Real-time patient monitoring devices send telemetry data to Azure IoT Hub for secure ingestion.
Azure Stream Analytics consumes telemetry from IoT Hub, applies clinical rules, and writes curated data to Azure Data Lake Storage.
Azure Data Factory periodically calls Azure API for FHIR to extract clinical records for analytical use cases.
Azure Data Factory transforms and loads FHIR data into structured zones in Azure Data Lake Storage.
Azure API for FHIR optionally writes FHIR snapshots or audit-related exports directly to the data lake for long-term retention.
Power BI Embedded reads curated datasets from Azure Data Lake Storage and renders HIPAA-aligned clinical dashboards for authenticated users.
Azure Stream Analytics publishes processing metrics to Azure Monitor, which forwards telemetry to Log Analytics for operational insights.

services.name: Azure Monitor

services.name: Log Analytics

connections.label: Issue and validate OAuth2/OIDC tokens for FHIR API access
Route create/read/update FHIR resources to managed healthcare data plane
Stream patient device telemetry events for real-time processing
Trigger downstream processing for threshold breaches and enrichments
Write processed vitals as FHIR Observations (near real-time)
Upsert clinical context (Patient/Encounter/Observation) after validation
Export bulk FHIR datasets for analytics, retention, and downstream sharing
Query clinical datasets for dashboard visuals (FHIR-backed reporting)
Load curated/bulk datasets for longitudinal clinical analytics dashboards
Authenticate clinicians and enforce tenant/user access for embedded reports
Retrieve secrets and certificates for secure downstream calls
Emit application metrics and traces for processing health and failures
Persist and query collected logs/metrics in a central workspace

workflow.description: Clinician or partner application authenticates and obtains tokens for clinical API access.
FHIR requests (create/read/update) are served through the FHIR API and handled by the healthcare data platform.
Patient monitoring devices publish telemetry securely into the ingestion layer.
Streaming jobs transform telemetry into clinical signals and route events for deeper processing when needed.
Processed vitals and enriched clinical updates are written back as FHIR resources for real-time clinical context.
Bulk exports land in the HIPAA-aligned data lake for retention and longitudinal analytics workloads.
Embedded Power BI dashboards authenticate users and render clinical insights from FHIR and lake-backed datasets.
Operational telemetry from the compute layer is collected centrally for monitoring and investigation.

FHIR API reads and writes patient records in the healthcare data platform

FHIR data and telemetry are exported to HIPAA-compliant storage for analytics
Curated datasets power clinical dashboards and reports
Operational metrics are collected and centralized for monitoring

connections.label: Route authenticated FHIR REST calls from partner systems
Stream patient vitals telemetry for continuous analysis
Trigger event-driven transformation for threshold breaches and observations
Upsert Observation and Encounter resources into FHIR endpoint
Persist validated clinical resources in managed health data service
Export longitudinal clinical data for HIPAA retention and audit
Refresh dashboard datasets from curated clinical data files
Serve near-real-time patient metrics for clinical dashboard visuals
Validate OAuth tokens and enforce role-based API access
Authenticate clinicians before dashboard access
Retrieve FHIR API credentials and signing secrets at runtime
Publish function execution metrics and pipeline health telemetry
Forward aggregated monitoring signals for searchable retention

workflow.description: External EHR and partner applications submit secured FHIR API requests.
Connected patient devices continuously send vital signs into the telemetry intake layer.
Streaming jobs detect clinical conditions and emit processed events for serverless handling.
Serverless logic retrieves secrets securely and maps events to standard FHIR resources.
FHIR resources are stored and governed through Azure Health Data Services.
Clinical datasets are exported to compliant storage for retention, audit, and downstream analytics.
Clinical dashboards are refreshed using curated storage exports and near-real-time health datasets.
Clinicians authenticate via enterprise identity before viewing patient dashboards.
Operational telemetry from processing services is centralized for monitoring and investigations.

connections.label: FHIR API requests to Health Data Services
Stream patient telemetry to Stream Analytics
Write aggregated insights to Cosmos DB
Archive raw streams to Blob Storage
Store and retrieve FHIR resources
Access and process FHIR data
Retrieve raw data for batch processing
Push aggregated data to Power BI datasets
Authenticate FHIR API calls
Secure dashboard access
Retrieve database connection strings
Access storage account keys
Emit custom metrics and logs
Send logs to Log Analytics

workflow.description: Healthcare providers and devices send FHIR data via Azure API for FHIR and real-time telemetry via IoT Hub.
Azure Health Data Services processes FHIR requests and stores/retrieves data from Cosmos DB. IoT Hub streams data to Stream Analytics.
Stream Analytics performs real-time analytics on patient monitoring data, writes aggregated insights to Cosmos DB and archives raw data to Blob Storage.
Azure Functions orchestrates batch processing, retrieves data from Cosmos DB and Blob Storage, and pushes aggregated results to Power BI Embedded for dashboards.
Microsoft Entra ID authenticates all access to FHIR API and Power BI dashboards. Key Vault provides secrets to Functions and Stream Analytics.
Azure Monitor collects metrics and logs from Functions and other services, forwarding to Log Analytics for analysis and alerting.
